channel.title: CVE Feed for ShortPixel -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ShortPixel -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-6737|2024-08-02T08:42:07.264Z -- shortpixel -- enable%20media%20replace
item.description: The Enable Media Replace plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting via the SHORTPIXEL_DEBUG parameter in all versions up to, and including, 4.1.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a link. Exploiting this vulnerability requires the attacker to know the ID of an attachment uploaded by the user they are attacking.

item.title: CVE-2023-32512|2024-08-02T15:18:37.254Z -- shortpixel -- shortpixel%20adaptive%20images%20%E2%80%93%20webp%2C%20avif%2C%20cdn%2C%20image%20optimization
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in ShortPixel ShortPixel Adaptive Images – WebP, AVIF, CDN, Image Optimization plugin <= 3.7.1 versions.

item.title: CVE-2024-35172|2024-08-02T03:07:47.122Z -- shortpixel -- shortpixel%20adaptive%20images
item.description: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in ShortPixel ShortPixel Adaptive Images.This issue affects ShortPixel Adaptive Images: from n/a through 3.8.3.

item.title: CVE-2024-31230|2024-08-02T01:46:04.738Z -- shortpixel -- shortpixel%20adaptive%20images
item.description: Missing Authorization vulnerability in ShortPixel ShortPixel Adaptive Images.This issue affects ShortPixel Adaptive Images: from n/a through 3.8.2.

item.title: CVE-2024-4689|2024-08-01T20:47:41.563Z -- shortpixel -- shortpixel%20adaptive%20images
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in ShortPixel ShortPixel Adaptive Images.This issue affects ShortPixel Adaptive Images: from n/a through 3.8.3.

item.title: CVE-2024-5945|2024-06-21T07:39:58.068Z -- shortpixel -- wp%20svg%20images
item.description: The WP SVG Images plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘type’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 4.2 due to insufficient input sanitization. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Author-level access and above, who have permissions to upload sanitized files, to bypass SVG sanitization and inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-4689|2024-06-04T17:56:22.229Z -- shortpixel -- shortpixel%20adaptive%20images
item.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in ShortPixel ShortPixel Adaptive Images.This issue affects ShortPixel Adaptive Images: from n/a through 3.8.3.

item.description: The WP SVG Images plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘type’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 4.2 due to insufficient input sanitization. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Author-level access and above, who have permissions to upload sanitized files, to bypass SVG sanitization and inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
